column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)
column13: Solution Description

The Board has considered environmental and sustainability metrics for senior executive remuneration, and some have been included as part of individual deliverables. The Board will continue to view the most appropriate Group and separate measures for Reece aligned with our sustainability strategy and the long-term success of the Group.

Gathering insight involves collecting information, knowledge, or understanding about a sustainability development strategy. The goal of gathering insight is to make informed decisions, solve problems, or gain a more comprehensive understanding of a sustainability development strategy.

Enhancing data capture involves improving the methods and processes of collecting information, resulting in more accurate, comprehensive, and valuable data. It is crucial for organizations aiming to make informed decisions, gain insights, and optimize their operations about sustainability development strategy.\t

Emissions reduction aspirations refer to the goals, targets, or ambitions set by Reece Limited to decrease the amount of greenhouse gas emissions released into the atmosphere. These aspirations are typically part of broader efforts to mitigate climate change, improve environmental sustainability, and address the impacts of human activities on the planet.

The Reece Foundation was established 2022 as an independent charity to empower trades to make a difference and connect their essential skills to communities needing clean water and sanitation access. It's a shared purpose fundamental to Reece and reflects water's vital role as a source of life, dignity, and connection in communities.\t

Reece publishes a Modern Slavery Statement annually under the Australian Modern Slavery Act (Cth) 2018. This document details our efforts to mitigate risks to human rights within our operations and supply chain.

Historically, the building materials and trade industry has had low gender diversity, and Reece is responsible as a business to change this. Reece has made progress and already ranks well ahead of the broader trade industry on gender representation, but now, Reece has much more to do.

Reece goal is to make sure their team, as well as their customers and visitors, go home safe every day. Reece takes a holistic view, believing everyone can leave work in the same condition, if not better, physically and mentally.

column7: Reece policy commitments are kept under review and, in some instances, differ by market, as we are at a much grander stage of maturity in our ANZ business than in our younger US business, acquired in 2018.
Different policy commitments are embedded across reports, including AR, SR, CGS, and MSS. Policy commitments are outlined, such as Formal Policy, Privacy Policy, Health and Safety Policy, etc.

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: External whistleblowing service refers to a third-party, independent mechanism or platform that organizations establish to allow employees, stakeholders, or individuals associated with the organization to report concerns, misconduct, or unethical behaviour. The purpose of an external whistleblowing service is to provide an alternative reporting channel outside the regular organizational hierarchy.

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: Raising a concern through an online portal typically involves navigating to the relevant section on a website and following the provided instructions. Reece Limited provides an online portal, such as a company website.

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: Raising concern over the phone with a company typically involves contacting the Company's customer support or appropriate department to express your issue or complaint. Reece Limited provides a phone number for seeking and raising a concern.

column7: During the reporting period, Reece Limited and its subsidiaries have not identified any instance of non-compliance against applicable laws and regulations.

column13: ASX announcements refer to official statements and disclosures by companies listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX). These announcements are crucial for maintaining transparency and informing the market, investors, and the public about significant events, developments, or changes within a listed company.
Reece Limited uses its websites to communicate with various stakeholders, including customers, investors, employees, and the media. It may involve news updates, press releases, and announcements.

Annual reports serve as a primary communication between a company and its stakeholders, including shareholders, investors, employees, customers, suppliers, and the broader community. Reece Limited provides a comprehensive update on the Company's activities and achievements.

Dividend history refers to a record of the dividends a company has paid its shareholders over a specific period. Dividends are payments made by a company to its shareholders as a distribution of profits.

Governance documents provide a framework for how an organization is directed, controlled, and operated. These documents outline the rules, structures, processes, and principles that guide the decision-making and behaviour of individuals within the organization.

Webcasts are a means for Reece Limited to communicate directly with its shareholders. These events may convey important information, such as financial results, strategic updates, or significant announcements.

Fundamental market analysts play a crucial role in research by providing analysis, insights, and recommendations related to financial instruments, investment opportunities, industries, and economic trends. Their primary purpose is to help investors, businesses, and stakeholders make informed decisions.

Reece AGM is structured to encourage active participation by shareholders on any matter relevant to the performance and operation of the Company. All resolutions put to shareholders are determined by a poll.

The Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey for customers measures customer satisfaction and loyalty. NPS is a widely used metric that helps businesses assess how likely their customers are to recommend their products or services to others.

A Supplier Engagement Forum is where a company can interact and collaborate with its suppliers. Such a forum fosters open communication, builds strong relationships, and creates a collaborative environment.

The Board has approved a Continuous Disclosure Policy, which outlines our approach to ensuring timely disclosure of material information. Reece is committed to meeting their obligations under the ASX Listing Rules for balanced and timely disclosure of relevant information.

column8: System of Risk Management and Internal Control
column13: Reece, the declaration provided under Section 295A of the Corporations Act 2001 is founded on a sound system of risk management and internal control. The system operates effectively in all material respects, including financial reporting and business risks.

Reece Limited provide a signed representation letter to the external auditors and the Board that supports that the periodic reports give an accurate and fair view, that there is integrity in the statements, and that the financial statements comply with the Corporations Act 2001 and relevant Accounting Standards. The certification process is reviewed annually to ensure it remains fit for purpose.

The following materiality matrix for FY23 presents material issues for Reece in FY23 by significance of impact and importance to our stakeholders. These material issues are continued focus areas for the Company as we drive sustainable value creation.

column7: Reece's topics are environmental issues, mental health and well-being, customer feels, and a supportive workplace.

Reece's vision is that over the coming years, Reece will be able to act as a partner for their customers by providing products, solutions, knowledge and insight about adapting to a lower carbon world.

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
